intro: Galium psilophyllum, commonly known as small-leaved bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers clustered in cymes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium psilophyllum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
